sn35.26:1.1: “Mendicants, without directly knowing and completely understanding the all, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.
sn35.26:1.2: And what is the all, without directly knowing and completely understanding which, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering?
sn35.26:1.3: Without directly knowing and completely understanding the eye, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.
sn35.26:1.4: Without directly knowing and completely understanding sights …
sn35.26:1.7: painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.
sn35.26:1.8: Without directly knowing and completely understanding the ear … the nose … the tongue …
sn35.26:1.14: the mind, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.
sn35.26:1.15: Without directly knowing and completely understanding thoughts …
sn35.26:1.18: painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.
sn35.26:1.19: This is the all, without directly knowing and completely understanding which, without dispassion for it and giving it up, you can’t end suffering.
sn35.26:2.1: By directly knowing and completely understanding the all, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering.
sn35.26:2.2: And what is the all, directly knowing and completely understanding which, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering?
sn35.26:2.3: By directly knowing and completely understanding the eye …
sn35.26:2.8: the ear … the nose … the tongue …
sn35.26:2.14: the mind, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering.
sn35.26:2.15: By directly knowing and completely understanding thoughts …
sn35.26:2.18: painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering.
sn35.26:2.19: This is the all, directly knowing and completely understanding which, having dispassion for it and giving it up, you can end suffering.”
